pages.text: Archaeoconularia is a conulariid organism from the Ordovician of Europe. It is the largest conulariid known, with specimens able to grow up to half a meter tall. As conulariids, they would have stuck to the substrate, using their tentacles, which poked out of their shells, to capture prey.
